article:
'Spontaneous remission', also called 'spontaneous healing' or 'spontaneous
regression', is an unexpected improvement or cure from a disease that appears to
be progressing in its severity. These terms are commonly used for unexpected
transient or final improvements in cancer. Spontaneous remissions concern
cancers of the haematopoietic system (blood cancer, e.g. leukemia), while
spontaneous regressions concern palpable tumors; however, both notions are often
used interchangeably.
headings: Frequency of spontaneous regression in cancer
